instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 - no CPU activity
threads.message:
Hi,
No sign of corrosion. 20V on both USB-C ports. 0,33-0,037A. Fan starts, but no chime, no activity on external USB or image on external display.
L7210/L7220 0,9V which seems ok to me. Where to start?

threads.title: 820-00840 - no CPU activity
threads.message:
When board works, cannot drop to 0.037A.

Did you try the board alone, no device connected?
Keep only charger and USB test pendrive.

Try new BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: 820-00840 - no CPU activity
threads.message:
I looked wrong. It took 0.37A. 
Just replaced BIOS from a donor board before I read your post. It shows the image of apple now. I don't have BIOS programmer. Have to order reprogrammed BIOS chip from Ebay.uk.
Thanks 2informaticos  (y)

threads.title: 820-00840 - no CPU activity
threads.message:
I'm not sure how clean is preprogrammed BIOS.
Do they write your serial in at least?

threads.title: 820-00840 - no CPU activity
threads.message: Yes, they do. I send LB number, like 820-00840-A and serial number. It's about 15 pounds.

threads.title: 820-00840 - no CPU activity
threads.message:
CH341 is 5 bucks.
And you can pay Medusa programmer repairing 3 motherboards...
